item.title: Gex Trilogy bundles 3 games and numerous improvements, and it's coming in summer 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/gex-trilogy-bundles-3-games-and-numerous-improvements-and-its-coming-in-summer-2025

Let's talk about Gex, baby.

Limited Run has dropped a new video teaser showing off its upcoming release of Gex Trilogy.

The trilogy - which bundles the original PS1 2D platformer, Gex, and the two 3D sequels: Gex: Enter the Gecko & Gex 3: Deep Cover Gecko - aren't "just" re-releases, but include a number of extras and improvements to "bring Gex back into prime time", including native widescreen.

Other improvements includes save states, rewind, widescreen support, and behind-the-scenes content including classic adverts, a music player, and an exclusive interview with Dana Gould, the voice of Gex.

You can see Gex in action in the teaser below:

"Things are about to get weirder than the 4th of July at Rick James' place! Everyone's favorite tail-whipping, channel-surfing gecko is back in a collection that features all of his best-selling adventures!" Limited Run teased.

Whilst there's no firm release date as yet, Gex Trilogy is expected to release in summer/Q3 2025 for Nintendo Switch, PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S.

ICYMI, previously unseen footage from a demo for an unannounced Gex sequel made the rounds back in 2022. The footage showed a character named Gex Jr. making his way through what appears to be a cinema.

Gex Jr. jumps from screen to popcorn machine and on to yet another screen (one of which appears to show Gex from Crystal Dynamics' original games), all while chugging down cans of fizzy soda and making some pretty dated references.
